parts.text:
The released FOI documents reveal the Australian Electoral Commission (AEC), led by Commissioner Tom Rogers, engaged enthusiastically and dedicated significant public resources to a Sky News documentary hosted by Peta Credlin. This engagement, framed internally as a "prominent explainer piece we would want to do for that audience," suggests a targeted public relations effort rather than a neutral dissemination of information.

Key findings raising scrutiny include:

1.  **Questionable Resource Allocation and Potential Waste:** AEC staff, including a Principal Media Advisor and Communications Officer, committed considerable time and effort to coordinate, schedule, and supply an extensive array of archival footage (including "printing of postal vote applications," "people counting votes," and "people at voting centres") for a commercial media production. Furthermore, the AEC offered and used its "new command centre" and potentially operational warehouses as filming locations, diverting valuable public assets and staff attention in the lead-up to a federal election. Commissioner Rogers' initial response, "Love it – the more we do, the better it is," underscores a proactive drive for media presence that appears to prioritize public relations over a strict focus on core electoral duties.
2.  **Compromised Perceived Impartiality:** Despite the AEC's statutory role as an independent electoral body, internal communications reveal a clear awareness of host Peta Credlin's prior public commentary, which included endorsing recommendations focused "with a heavy focus on multiple voting and enrolment / voting ID" and expressing "fears of ballot rigging at Australian elections." The AEC staff explicitly briefed Commissioner Rogers that Credlin "wouldn't be surprised if she asks pointed questions about integrity matters, particularly multiple voting." Despite this knowledge of a host with a documented history of scrutinizing electoral integrity in a manner that could undermine public confidence, the Commissioner proceeded enthusiastically with the interview and extensive support. This raises serious questions about the AEC's judgment and its commitment to maintaining an unassailable perception of neutrality, especially when engaging with a partisan media outlet and a host known for controversial views on electoral processes.
3.  **Targeted Engagement with Implied Bias:** The AEC's eagerness to produce an "explainer piece for that audience" (referring to Sky News viewers) suggests a calculated strategy to engage with a specific demographic, rather than a broad, even-handed approach to public information. This targeted engagement, coupled with the known biases of the platform and host, hints at a potential overreach into managing narratives or countering specific public sentiments, rather than simply informing the general public about electoral processes.

prompt:
As a government skeptic, summarize the following FOI documents. Assume a critical stance, scrutinizing government claims, highlighting potential inefficiencies, overreach, or lack of transparency. Focus on findings that suggest waste, power abuse, or questionable decision-making.

Campaign Uncovered.

Tom Rogers | Electoral Commissioner
Australian Electoral Commission

Sent: Tuesday, 25 January 2022 5:30 PM
To: Tom Rogers 
Cc: media <media@aec.gov.au>
Subject: FW: SkyNews Election Special IV request for Commissioner Rogers [SEC=OFFICIAL]

Tom, an interesting one for your consideration here. This sounds exactly like the sort of prominent
explainer piece we would want to do for that audience I think…We could even offer up meeting at
certain locations (OPC, command centre come to mind).

Evan Ekin-Smyth | Principal Media Advisor
Director, Media & Digital Engagement
Australian Electoral Commission
T: 
M: 
www.aec.gov.au/media

From: media <media@aec.gov.au> 
Sent: Tuesday, 25 January 2022 5:27 PM
To: 
Cc: media <media@aec.gov.au>
Subject: RE: SkyNews Election Special IV request for Commissioner Rogers [SEC=OFFICIAL]

Hi


--- Page 2 ---

Sounds like a very interesting and worthwhile pre-election endeavour, and the successful conduct of
the federal election by the AEC is certainly a part of that. We’ll chat to the Commissioner and come
back to you soon.

Cheers
Evan

Evan Ekin-Smyth
Australian Electoral Commission
T: 
 M: 
www.aec.gov.au/media 

 X: 

From: 
Sent: Tuesday, 25 January 2022 5:01 PM
To: media <media@aec.gov.au>
Subject: SkyNews Election Special IV request for Commissioner Rogers

CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the Australian Federal Government. Do not click links
or open attachments unless you recognise the sender and know the content is safe.

Hi 

Thanks for the chat just now.

I am producing The Campaign Matters 1 hour documentary special hosted by Peta Credlin to go out
to a national audience on the Foxtel/SkyNews/Flash platforms, in the lead up to coming election.

The program will be a behind-the-scenes look at federal elections, with specific reference to the
coming contest; and explain how federal elections work and the process behind elections.

With the help of ex-leaders, campaign directors, sitting Members, candidates and psephologists Peta
will take a comprehensive look at what makes a successful campaign. 

We are hoping Mr Rogers will agree to be interviewed as part of this project, and Peta is very happy
to discuss it further over the phone. 

Specific areas of interest to be discussed include Australia’s electoral architecture and the need for in-
person voting in what will be a ‘covid’ election.

In terms of timing, we would hope to film the interview ASAP, within the next 4 weeks.

Please advise next steps and if I can provide more information.

Many thanks in advance,

Producer – Sky News Documentaries

Email:

--- Page 1 ---

Hi Evan,

Apologies for this, I have just firmed up another IV at PH for Wed 16th.

Would Tuesday 15th at 9.30 be a possibility for the interview please?

And I am very keen to grab the footage of previous elections asap. And file sharing is perfect.

It would be great to be able to illustrate in pictures how voting/counting/declaring has progressed
over time with new technology etc.

Many thanks

From: media <media@aec.gov.au> 
Sent: Friday, 28 January 2022 1:16 PM
To: 
Cc: media <media@aec.gov.au>
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: SkyNews Election Special IV request for Commissioner Rogers
[SEC=OFFICIAL]

Hi 

Wednesday 16 Feb at 9:30 would work for us. The Commissioner’s office and the prior set up timing is
fine. We’re located at 10 Mort St in the city.

The AEC’s new command centre is in the building as well and would likely make for good overlay (we
can show you it when you’re here and see what you think). 

I’ll come back to you re the warehouse details. We also have a range of footage of previous elections -
voting, counting, declaring nominations etc - and we can send things to you via file sharing if you
want….

Cheers
Evan

Sent with BlackBerry Work
(www.blackberry.com)

From:


--- Page 3 ---

Date: Thursday, 27 Jan 2022, 5:32 pm
To: media <media@aec.gov.au>
Subject: FW: [EXTERNAL] RE: SkyNews Election Special IV request for Commissioner Rogers [SEC=OFFICIAL]

CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the Australian Federal Government. Do not click links
or open attachments unless you recognise the sender and know the content is safe.

Hi again Evan,

Our shooting schedule is starting to firm up now, and Peta will be in Canberra on Mon 14th , Tues 15th
and Wed 16th Feb. Is there any availability in the Commissioner diary for any of these days? during the
morning. 0930-1030?  We would need 90 mins to set-up prior, and 30mins to wrap. And then we
could reset to the Warehouse for 30 mins.

In terms of Interview  location is the Commissioners Office a possibility?

Many thanks

From: 
Sent: Wednesday, 26 January 2022 4:49 PM
To: media <media@aec.gov.au>
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: SkyNews Election Special IV request for Commissioner Rogers
[SEC=OFFICIAL]

Hi Evan,

Thanks for the prompt response, and that is great news. Also love the suggestion to shoot within an
(semi) operational scenario.

In terms of the interview, it would be best to do in a controlled and quiet environment.

Can I give you a call to discuss tomorrow/Thursday? When is a good time? And would there be archive
of the count from 2019 and other previous elections?

Many thanks

From: media <media@aec.gov.au> 
Sent: Wednesday, 26 January 2022 2:49 PM
To: 
Cc: media <media@aec.gov.au>
Subject: [EXTERNAL] RE: SkyNews Election Special IV request for Commissioner Rogers
[SEC=OFFICIAL]

Hi


--- Page 4 ---

Confirming that the Commissioner is happy to help with this. If it suits, a discussion could be done
within an AEC premises or two that is a touch operational – for example, we lease warehouses where
we organise and dispatch polling materials, train polling staff and conduct the count (this sort of
venue could help visualise the behind-the-scenes explainer of how we deliver the election and
provide some good overlay).

I am assuming a Canberra location but let me know if that’s not right and I’ll then advise options. Also,
let me know if there is a preferred date/time and I can see what works on our end.

Cheers
Evan

Evan Ekin-Smyth
Australian Electoral Commission

Hi 

Re the warehouse, is it workable from a Sydney location (sending a Syd-based cameraman)? Our
facility in Syd Olympic Park is more advanced in readiness than the Queanbeyan site. Let me know
and, if so, we can tee up a time.

With remote voting, we’ll work on getting you raw footage. In the interim, you may also be able to
just scrape stuff from https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pcRpYkJZBEk or pan on high res stills from
https://www.flickr.com/photos/auselectoralcom/albums/72157710806573631.

I’ve also talked to the Commissioner re Peta’s interview and he’s happy if we setup in the AEC’s new
command centre for it. Anyway, there’ll be options to do that or an office backdrop when you get
here on the 14th.

Cheers
Evan

Evan Ekin-Smyth | Principal Media Advisor
Director, Media & Digital Engagement
Australian Electoral Commission

www.aec.gov.au

From: Evan Ekin-Smyth 
Date: Sunday, 13 Feb 2022, 16:38
To: Tom Rogers 
Cc: 
Subject: Tomorrow’s Credlin interview[SEC=OFFICIAL]

Tom

Ahead of tomorrow morning’s interview I thought it wise to give you a reminder of
Credlin’s last prominent communication on electoral matters -
see https://www.skynews.com.au/australia-news/its-farcical-australias-voting-system-
doesnt-safeguard-against-multiple-voting/video/fe27a74c6fad37c4ae506b46b2af744a.

This was endorsing McGrath’s JSCEM recs with a heavy focus on multiple voting and
enrolment / voting ID. She also wrote an opinion piece in support of her on-air spiel -
see https://thewest.com.au/opinion/peta-credlin-fears-of-ballot-rigging-at-australian-
elections-ng-17a031b6f2ef5f10c794b07107b571d9.

Also, here is a preview piece for the doco she is putting together (the purpose of the doco
stated as being an opportunity to get behind the scenes of a campaign).
See https://www.google.com.au/amp/s/amp.theaustralian.com.au/business/peta-credlin-
documentary-to-unveil-secrets-behind-election-campaigns/news-
story/82c72472c74d0a8972597b342b70bcac

While she may stick tight to the purpose of the doco (for us, what it takes to deliver the
election) I wouldn’t be surprised if she asks pointed questions about integrity matters,
particularly multiple voting. 

The interview is at 9:30 in the command centre. I’ll be around beforehand organising their
camera people but can get 

 to babysit if you want to have a chat…

Cheers
Evan 

Sent with BlackBerry Work
(www.blackberry.com)

Provide only the markdown formatted summary text. Do not include any conversational filler or preamble.
